attributes.comment:
From press releases from USCIS, they pointed out the suggested fee increase is
66%, not 86% given some of the fees are inclusive of services previously
provided separately. They named I-485 Fee as an example, which will increase to
$905 from $325.

However, USCIS neglects that fact that NOT ALL I-485 customers file for I-131
and even less apply for I-131 twice. Adding two-time fees for I-131 and saying
the adjusted fee is only a 66% increase is not a convincing argument.

I do hope USCIS will enhance their services as well as reducing document
backlogs as proposed. However, what customers are complaining most about UCSCIS
is their lack of customer care and I doubt whether it will be fixed by just
putting more money in training.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Kat K. Choi
